oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Voltiegeur, Infantry, Dragoon, Artillery (Campaign Uniform, 1841-1851)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Artist H.A. Ogden received a commission from the United States Army to create color illustrations depicting the American soldier from the Revolutionary War to 1888. Depicted here is a mounted dragoon, two infantrymen, and a voltigeur with an artillery gun crew in the background from the Mexican War era. The voltigeur regiment wore light gray uniforms and were designed to be an elite unit of foot soldiers armed with the Model 1841 Rifle. The regiment ceased to exist at the end of the Mexican War.
